result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bryant O'Neil Scott

records.addlTxt:
Bryant Scott appears in person. Attorney Conrardy appears by video. Gregg Herman appears in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Bench warrant issued 10/3/2022 is cancelled. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.
all conditions of bond remain as previously set.
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $1000.00

3:29 PM Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott not in court. Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Conrardy is in trial in another court on another matter. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court in person .  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Defense Counsel made contact with the court and is unable to appear. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Indigency Hearing held. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by the court.  
Defendant agreed to repay Milwaukee County for the fees and expense paid by Milwaukee County. 
The court appointed Attorney Nicholas Conrardy  to represent defendant  at County expense  at the rate of $100.00 per hour.
Defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00  Per Month. Repayment to begin 45 Days after the conclusion of the case.  
Defendant advised failure to pay will result in a Civil Judgment
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and No driving without a valid license.
Court ordered bench warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  William Ackell  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Return on Warrant. Defense counsel provides explanation of defendant's non appearance.
Court advised defendant does not qualify for public defender representation. 
Court vacated the Bench Warrant, Reinstated the Conditions of Bond. Defense request a preliminary hearing date.  
Court ordered case adjourned back to Branch 19.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 1000.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
The defendant having failed to appear with the conditions of his release, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Bryant O'Neil Scott in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/18/22 @ 2:30p
